alert.note: Alert for Todd (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:39PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Todd County through 730 PM CDT... At 638 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deer Creek, or 31 miles north of Alexandria, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hewitt around 650 PM CDT. Bertha around 655 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Eagle Bend and Clarissa. This includes U.S. Highway 71 between mile markers 197 and 219. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
